name: permeation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of spreading through something and becoming present in every part of it: The lake loses much of its water through permeation into the underlying sand. The next chapter of the book will discuss the permeation of rock music into wider society.
More examplesFewer examplesThe meat had not been marinated for long enough to allow a really deep permeation of the spices.Many commentators have drawn attention to the internet's permeation of every aspect of modern life.They adopted a policy of infiltrating radical groups by steady permeation.
